org.youscope.common.table

Class TableHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.youscope.common.table.TableHelper

  • public class TableHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    Static class providing some useful helper functions to create, consume or fill tables.
    Author:
    Moritz Lang

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void assertSupported(java.lang.Class<? extends java.io.Serializable> valueType)
      Helper function throwing a TableException if given value type is not supported by YouScope, and doing nothing otherwise.

    • Method Detail

      • createEntry

        public static <T extends java.io.Serializable> org.youscope.common.table.TableEntryAdapter<T> createEntry(java.lang.Class<T> valueType,
                                                                                                          T value,
                                                                                                          boolean nullAllowed)
                                                                                                   throws TableException,
                                                                                                          java.lang.NullPointerException
        Creates a table entry containing the given value.
        Parameters:
        value - The value for which an entry containing the value should be constructed.
        valueType - The precise value type of the entry, that is, one of the value types returned by getSupportedValueTypes().
        nullAllowed - indicating if assigning null to the returned table entry is allowed or not.
        Returns:
        The constructed entry.
        Throws:
        TableException - Thrown if entry could not be constructed, e.g. if value type was invalid.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - Thrown if valueType is null.

      • getSupportedValueTypes

        public static java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Class<? extends java.io.Serializable>> getSupportedValueTypes()
        Returns all currently supported value types of YouScope. Currently (2015-11-20), YouScope only supports a limited set of value types for tables. These are String, Integer, Double, Float, Boolean and Long. Note that Object.getClass() is different from int.class(), and that the former is supported only.
        Returns:
        Currently supported value types of YouScope.

      • isSupportedValueType

        public static boolean isSupportedValueType(java.lang.Class<? extends java.io.Serializable> valueType)
        Checks if the given value type is supported by YouScope. Currently, YouScope only supports a limited set of value types for tables.
        Parameters:
        valueType - The value type to check for support.
        Returns:
        True if supported, false otherwise.

      • assertSupported

        public static void assertSupported(java.lang.Class<? extends java.io.Serializable> valueType)
                            throws TableException
        Helper function throwing a TableException if given value type is not supported by YouScope, and doing nothing otherwise. See isSupportedValueType(Class). Currently, YouScope only supports a limited set of value types for tables. See getSupportedValueTypes() for the list of supported value types.
        Parameters:
        valueType - Value type to check.
        Throws:
        TableException - Thrown if value type is not supported.
